lines.content: Used ChatGPT to generate in character lines to fit the tone of Horus from Warhammer 40K.
Added some of the best generated lines into the program.
ChatGPT came up with some surprisingly in-character and creative lines.
Used ChatGPT to generate JUnit tests for Tasks and its subclasses
by inputting the contents of each file into ChatGPT. Although I was not satisfied with
the accurry and implementation of the tests generated by ChatGPT, the generated code
was still useful as a template to write my own tests and as a guide of what cases I should test.
While generating JUnit tests, ChatGPT also found a bug with my program, which I then fixed.

This is Horus, your personal assistant to help track tasks, deadlines and events!
Use the commands `todo`, `deadline` and `event` to add tasks:
Use `list` to view your added tasks:
Use the commands `mark` to mark tasks as done:
The task will be marked as done as shown when calling `list`:
Use the commands `unmark` to unmark a task:
Use the `find` command to search for tasks using keywords:
public static DialogBox getUserDialog(String s, Image i) {
public static DialogBox getDukeDialog(String s, Image i) {
* A launcher class to workaround classpath issues.
* A GUI for Duke using FXML.
private final Horus horus = new Horus();
* Creates two dialog boxes, one echoing user input and the other containing Duke's reply and then appends them to
* the dialog container. Clears the user input after processing.
* Sends a greeting message to the user.
* A program that can be used to manage a list of tasks and save onto a local file
* Initializes Horus and retrieves any previously saved tasks from a save file
* @param filePath A string representing the file path where any tasks added will be saved.
*                 If the file already exists, Horus will initialize with any tasks saved on the file
//                greetingMessage += "Retrieving saved tasks from local file.\n";
greetingMessage += "Summoning the record of oaths from the Chapter’s vaults.\n";
//            greetingMessage += "Error: Unable to access local files";
greetingMessage += "Error: The archives are sealed. Local data cannot be reclaimed.";
//        greetingMessage += "\nHello! I'm Horus\nWhat can I do for you?";
greetingMessage += "\nStand firm, warrior. I am Horus Lupercal,"
+ " primarch of the Lunar Wolves, Warmaster of the Imperium of Man and keeper of your sacred charges."
+ "\nSpeak now, what duty shall I inscribe for you?";
* Initializes Horus using the default filepath
* Runs the Horus program, where the program will continuously execute input commands until program exits
* Get a greeting message to print when starting Horus
* Parses and executes user commands and return and response for the user
* @return String representing response for the user
* Saves contents of taskList into local file
* @return String representing response for the user
* Initializes and run Horus using Java's IO
* A class that is able to parse input strings and execute relevant commands on this.taskList
* @param taskList The TaskList on which future commands are executed
* Parses inputStr for commands and executes relevant commands on this.taskList
* @return String to be printed by Ui
//The first element of inputArray represents the command to be executed
//      while the second element represents details of how to execute said command but may or may not exist
return "Until we next meet. The Emperor protects!\n";
return "Error: '" + inputStr + "' is not a sanctioned command.\n";
return "Error: You must designate the sacred number of the task to " + command + ".\n";
return "Error: A warrior’s oath cannot be sworn upon silence. The task description must be spoken.\n";
throw new RuntimeException(e); //Unknown source of exception
//            return "Error: " + inputArray[1] + " is not an integer. Please input task number to "
return "Error: " + inputArray[1] + " is no true number. Present a valid task number to "
* Class that represents a file with methods to read and write said file
* Creates an object representing the file at the input file path
* Creates directories if directories in file path does not exist
* Creates file if file does not exist
* @param filePath A string representing the file path to be initialized
* @throws IOException If file path cannot be accessed by the program
directory.mkdirs(); //Create relevant directories if they don't already exist
* Checks if file represented by Storage was newly created
* @return true if file was newly created and false otherwise
* Writes the contents of fileContents into this.file
* @param fileContents An array of strings with each string representing a line to be written
* @return String to be printed by Ui
//            return "Error: Unable to access local file, tasks not saved.";
return "Error: The archive denies us, your sacred duties lie unsaved in the void.";
return "By the Emperor’s will, the task litany is secured within the Chapter’s vaults.";
* Reads and returns the contents of this.file
* @return An array of strings with each string representing a line in the file
* @throws IOException if file cannot be accessed
//Counts number of lines in the file
//Resetting the line the scanner is at
* Class that handles inputs and outputs of the user
* Prints the contents of outputArray surrounded by lines
* @param outputArray An array containing strings to be printed,

* Prints the contents of outputString surrounded by lines
* @param outputString String to be printed to output terminal
* An object representing a time which may or may not contain a date and a time of day
* Creates a CustomDateTime object based on dateTimeStr
* @param dateTimeStr String which may or may not start with a date and time
//Will save contents to remainingStr instead of initializing a date
//Will save contents to remainingStr instead of initializing a time
* Checks if CustomDateTime contains a valid dateTime
* @return true if CustomDateTime contains a valid dateTime and false otherwise
* Postpone the date represented by CustomDateTime
* @param days Number of days to postpone the date by
* Advance the date represented by CustomDateTime
* @param days Number of days to advance the date by
* Returns a string similar to the input dateTimeStr
*         with dates and times converted to "MMM d yyyy" and "H:mma" formats
String dateStr = dateTime.toLocalDate().format( DateTimeFormatter.ofPattern("MMM d yyyy")) + " ";
* Returns a string similar to the input dateTimeStr
* @return A string from which a similar CustomDateTime object may be initialized from
* An object representing a task with a deadline
* @param taskStr String representing the description of task to be created
* An object representing an event task
* @param taskStr String representing the description of task to be created,
*                the start of the event denoted by /from
*                and the end of the event denoted by /to
* An exception that may be thrown when the user enters an input that cannot be correctly parsed
* An object representing a reccuring task with a deadline
* @param taskStr String representing the description of deadline task to be created
*               and the number of days this task will recur denoted by /every.
* @throws InvalidInputException If deadline is not a valid dateTime or /every is not an integer
throw new InvalidInputException("Error: Recurring deadline task " +
"must have a valid deadline (with format d/M/yyyy for dates and HHmm for times)");
throw new InvalidInputException("Error: Recurrence period must be an integer (denoted by /every)");
* An object representing a reccuring event task
* @param taskStr String representing the description of event task to be created
*               and the number of days this task will recur denoted by /every.
* @throws InvalidInputException If start and end are not a valid dateTime or /every is not an integer
throw new InvalidInputException("Error: Recurring event task " +
"must have a valid start and end (with format d/M/yyyy for dates and HHmm for times)");
throw new InvalidInputException("Error: Recurrence period must be an integer (denoted by /every)");

public static Task readTaskData(String taskData) throws InvalidInputException {

"Error: Event tasks must have a start and end (denoted with /from and /to).");

out += "Corruption detected. The data shard " + fileData[i] + " bears heresy unfit for duty.\n";

* Adds a task to the TaskList and prints a corresponding message if successful
* @param taskStr String containing task description and other details such as /to /from and /by
* @param taskType enum representing type of task to be added
* @return String to be printed by Ui
public String addTask(String taskStr, taskTypes taskType) throws InvalidInputException {
//            throw new InvalidInputException("Error: Description of task cannot be empty.");
throw new InvalidInputException("Error: A warrior’s oath cannot be sworn upon silence. " +
//                throw new InvalidInputException("Error: Deadline tasks must have a deadline (denoted with /by).");
"Error: A mission of deadline requires its appointed hour, denoted by /by.");
//                        "Error: Event tasks must have a start and end (denoted with /from and /to).");
"Error: An event must be bound by inception and cessation, /from and /to mark its span.");
//        return "Got it. I've added this task:\n  " + addedTask.toString() + "\n" +
//                "Now you have " + tasks.size() + " tasks in the list.\n";
return "It is done. A new duty is inscribed upon your litany:\n " + addedTask.toString() +
"\nYour sacred roster now bears " + tasks.size() + " charges.";
* Returns a string represnting the contents of taskList to be printed
* @return A string with each line representing a task in tasklist

* @return String to be printed by Ui

public String markTask(String taskId) throws InvalidInputException {
//                    "Error: No task at index " + taskId + ". Please input a valid task number." );
"Error: No such duty exists at index " + taskId + ". Speak a valid number, or be silent." );
//        return "Nice! I've marked this task as done:\n  " + tasks.get(taskIndex) + "\n";
return "The oath is fulfilled:\n " + tasks.get(taskIndex) + "\nLet it be recorded in the annals of duty.";

+ "\nBear it forward until victory is achieved.";

out += "\nYour ledger now holds " + tasks.size() + " sacred charges.";

return "Your search yields only silence. No duties align with your query.";

return "By vigilance, the following tasks answer your summons:\n" + out;

assertNotEquals(todoTask1, task1); //Task of a different class is not equal
assertEquals(todoTask1, todoTask2);   // Tasks with the same description are equal
